snippet: The publishing world — stinging after a 2012 in which the Pulitzer Prize board did not bestow a fiction award — hopes for a winner in 2013.
abstract: Booksellers are hoping the Pulitzer Prize board awards a 2013 prize in fiction, as they still reel from the decision not to award one in 2012; lack of a fiction prize for the first time in 35 years left authors, publishers and retailers lamenting the missed opportunity for buzz, sales and exposure for an industry that is struggling.
lead_paragraph: The publishing world — stinging after a 2012 in which the Pulitzer Prize board did not bestow a fiction award — hopes for a winner in 2013.

headline.seo: Booksellers Hope a Pulitzer Prize for Fiction Is Awarded
headline.main: Booksellers Hoping for Pulitzer in Fiction
headline.print_headline: Booksellers Hoping For Pulitzer In Fiction
